Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game class that setups maze and in-game screens in preparation for a game. In-game screens include the home screen and the maze game screen. All players and controllers are configured.
    Author:
    Mohammad Ghasembeigi, Gavin Tam, Jeremy Ma, Calvin Ko

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Constructor for creating a maze game. All fields set to default values, with a new player created with the default name and character. Difficulty is set on medium by default.

    • Method Detail

      • createMaze

        public void createMaze()
        Create a maze which scales in size based on game level and difficulty.

      • setIsGameOver

        public void setIsGameOver(boolean isGameOver)
        Updates the status of whether the game is over or not. The game is over when the player dies or all levels are completed.
        Parameters:
        isGameOver - if true, the game is over; if false, the game is still continuing.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks if the game is over or not. The game is over when the player has lost the game or has passed all the levels.
        Returns:
        true if game has been finished.

      • setIsInGame

        public void setIsInGame(boolean inGame)
        Updates the status of whether the player is still in the maze game or not.
        Parameters:
        inGame - if true, the game should be on the home screen; if false, the maze game should still be on.

      • isInGame

        public boolean isInGame()
        Checks if the player is still in the maze game or not.
        Returns:
        true if the player is still in the maze game.

      • setController

        public void setController(Controller c)
        Sets the controller for the player.
        Parameters:
        c - the controller for the player.

      • getController

        public Controller getController()
        Gets the controller for the player.
        Returns:
        c the controller for the player.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Gets the player of the game.
        Returns:
        the player of the game.

      • getMaze

        public Maze getMaze()
        Gets the maze of the game.
        Returns:
        the maze of the game.

      • updateScore

        public void updateScore()
        Updates the game score. The game is dependent on the number of treasure collected by the player, and the number of enemies killed.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Gets the current score of the game.
        Returns:
        the current score of the game.

      • checkNextLevel

        public void checkNextLevel()
        Checks if the game should be on the next level, and updates the game state accordingly. Next level should be reached when player exits the room.

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Get the current level of the game.
        Returns:
        the current level of the game.

      • setDifficulty

        public void setDifficulty(int difficulty)
        Sets the difficulty of the game.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - the difficulty of the game. Defined in Game.

      • getFinishedLevel

        public boolean getFinishedLevel()
        Checks if the maze of the current level has been completed. This information is mainly used by GameManager to determine what screens to show.
        Returns:
        true if the maze of the current level has been completed.

      • setFinishedLevel

        public void setFinishedLevel(boolean b)
        Sets the status that the maze of the current level has been completed.
        Parameters:
        b - if true, the maze of the current level has been completed; if false, the maze has not yet been completed.
